etymology.description: semantic 雨 ("rain") + phonetic 申; also ideogrammic: 雨 + 申 ("lightning").
etymology.interpretation: Rain provides the weather/lightning meaning, while 申 indicates the sound. The pairing also evokes lightning emerging from rain clouds, so historical analyses treat it as both phono-semantic and ideogrammic.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by dropping the 雨 component of 電 and compressing the rest into 电, a form influenced by cursive/abbreviated handwriting while retaining the phonetic 申 to preserve pronunciation.

parts.english: to state; to extend; 9th Earthly Branch

examples.chinese: 天空中有闪电(天空中有閃電。)
examples.english: There is lightning in the sky.

examples.chinese: 我给他打电话(我給他打電話。)
examples.english: I called him on the phone.

examples.chinese: 他发来一份电报(他發來一份電報。)
examples.pinyin: Tā fā lái yī fèn diànbào.
